name: MacBook Air 13-inch, M1, 2020
description: The Apple M1 chip gives the 13-inch MacBook Air speed and power beyond belief. With up to 18 hours of battery life.

name: MacBook Air 13-inch with M2 chip
description: The 13-inch MacBook Air with M2 chip features an 8-core CPU and up to a 10-core GPU, a 16-core Neural Engine, and a 13.6-inch Liquid Retina display. It offers up to 18 hours of battery life and includes a six-speaker sound system with force-cancelling woofers.

name: MacBook Air 15-inch with M2 chip
description: The 15-inch MacBook Air with M2 chip comes with a 10-core GPU, a 16-core Neural Engine, and a 15.3-inch Liquid Retina display. It supports up to 18 hours of video playback and fast charging, and features a six-speaker sound system with force-cancelling woofers.

name: MacBook Pro 16-inch, M3, 2023
description: The MacBook Pro 16-inch, M3 2023 model comes with an Apple M3 Pro or M3 Max chip and offers configurations with up to 8TB SSD storage. It features a high-fidelity six-speaker sound system, 1080p FaceTime HD camera, and a plethora of ports including MagSafe 3, HDMI, and Thunderbolt 4.

name: iMac 24-inch, M3, 2023
description: The 24-inch iMac 2023 model is powered by the Apple M3 chip with a 10-core GPU and supports up to 24GB unified memory. It boasts a 24-inch 4.5K Retina display and includes two Thunderbolt/USB 4 ports among other features.

name: Mac Mini, M2, 2023
description: The Mac Mini 2023 features the Apple M2 chip with an 8-core CPU, 10-core GPU, and a 16-core Neural Engine. Available with up to 24GB unified memory and up to 2TB SSD storage.

name: Mac Studio, M2 Max/M2 Ultra, 2023
description: The Mac Studio 2023 offers a choice between the Apple M2 Max chip and the Apple M2 Ultra chip, featuring up to a 24-core CPU and a 60-core GPU. It supports up to 192GB unified memory and 8TB SSD storage, and can support up to eight displays.

name: Mac Pro, M2 Ultra, 2023
description: The Mac Pro 2023 is equipped with the Apple M2 Ultra chip, featuring a 24-core CPU, 60-core GPU, and 32-core Neural Engine. It supports up to 192GB unified memory and 8TB SSD storage, and can support up to eight 4K displays or three 8K displays.

name: Studio Display
description: Studio Display features a 27-inch 5K Retina screen, 12MP Ultra Wide camera with Center Stage, a six-speaker sound system with Spatial Audio, and a variety of ports including three USB-C and one Thunderbolt 3 port.

name: Pro Display XDR
description: Pro Display XDR boasts a 32-inch 6K Retina XDR display, provides a peak brightness of 1600 nits, and includes a variety of ports such as Thunderbolt 3 and three USB-C ports.

name: iPad Pro 2023
description: The iPad Pro 2023 comes in 11-inch and 12.9-inch models, both powered by the Apple M2 chip with an 8-core CPU and 10-core GPU. The 11-inch model features a Liquid Retina display, while the 12.9-inch model has a Liquid Retina XDR display. Both support Apple Pencil (2nd generation) and include a Pro camera system.

name: iPad Air 2023
description: The iPad Air 2023 features a 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display and is powered by the Apple M1 chip with an 8-core CPU and 8-core GPU. It supports Apple Pencil (2nd generation) and includes a 12MP Wide camera.

name: iPad 10th generation 2023
description: The iPad 10th generation features a 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display, A14 Bionic chip, and supports the Apple Pencil (1st generation). It has a 12MP Wide back camera and a landscape 12MP Ultra Wide front camera with Center Stage.

name: iPad 9th generation 2023
description: The iPad 9th generation comes with a 10.2-inch Retina display, A13 Bionic chip, and supports Apple Pencil (1st generation). It features an 8MP Wide back camera and a 12MP Ultra Wide front camera with Center Stage.

name: iPad Mini 2023
description: The iPad Mini 2023 model features an advanced processor, vibrant display, and compatibility with Apple Pencil. It's designed for portability and performance.
